sofya.base
Class StreamReplicator

java.lang.Object
  sofya.base.StreamReplicator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public final class StreamReplicator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

Replicates character data received from an input stream to one or multiple output streams. The input stream is typically expected to be standard input, connected to a console.

A replicator can be put into a mode in which it responds to special "command" directives. These directives enable the replicator to be controlled from the console using in-stream commands sent via standard input. A command is signalled by the character '%', followed by a command sequence. The following are the currently recognized commands:

  • %b : Put the replicator into "broadcast" mode. In this mode, inputs received are copied to all associated output streams.
  • %c : Report the currently selected stream. This is the stream to which inputs are currently being copied.
  • %d : Disable in-stream command handling. No further command signals will be processed in the input.
  • %l : List the ids of all streams currently available for selection.
  • %q : Disconnect from standard input and allow the replicator to terminate.
  • %<id> : Select the stream associated with id to be the new target of input replication. Broadcast mode is disabled, if currently enabled.
  • %% : Send the literal character '%' to the selected output stream(s).

Currently, normal outputs of the replicator are sent to System.out.

Version:
08/17/2007
Author:
Alex Kinneer

Constructor Detail

StreamReplicator

public StreamReplicator(java.io.InputStream source,
                        java.io.PrintStream stderr)
Creates a new stream replicator.

A replicator is not initially connected to any streams, and any input that is received is discarded.

The input source is assumed to be interactive (e.g. standard input connected to a console), so in-stream command handling is enabled by default.

Parameters:
source - Stream from which data will be read.
stderr - Stream to which error outputs related to the operation of the replicator itself should be sent.

StreamReplicator

public StreamReplicator(java.io.InputStream source,
                        java.io.PrintStream stderr,
                        boolean enableStreamCmds)
Creates a new stream replicator.

A replicator is not initially connected to any streams, and any input that is received is discarded.

Parameters:
source - Stream from which data will be read.
stderr - Stream to which error outputs related to the operation of the replicator itself should be sent.
enableStreamCmds - Specifies whether the replicator should respond to command sequences in the input. Typically this should false for programmatic input to avoid unexpected behavior or data mangling, and true for an interactive input source.
Method Detail

connectStream

public java.lang.Integer connectStream(java.io.OutputStream sink,
                                       boolean closeOnShutdown,
                                       boolean buffered)
Connects a stream to the replicator. A stream connected to the replicator can be selected as a target to which the received input should be sent.

Parameters:
sink - Stream to connect to the replicator.
closeOnShutdown - Specifies whether the stream should be closed by the replicator when the input source is closed.
buffered - Specifies whether the replicator should internally buffer the stream.
Returns:
An automatically assigned identifier that can be used to select the stream.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the replicator is no longer connected to the input source.

connectStream

public boolean connectStream(java.io.OutputStream sink,
                             boolean closeOnShutdown,
                             boolean buffered,
                             java.lang.Integer id)
Connects a stream to the replicator.

Parameters:
sink - Stream to connect to the replicator.
closeOnShutdown - Specifies whether the stream should be closed by the replicator when the input source is closed.
buffered - Specifies whether the replicator should internally buffer the stream.
id - Identifier to be used to select the stream.
Returns:
true if the stream could be connected with the requested id, false if the id is already in use.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the replicator is no longer connected to the input source.

disconnectStream

public boolean disconnectStream(java.lang.Integer streamId,
                                boolean close)
Disconnects a stream from the replicator.

If the disconnected stream is the currently selected stream, the currently selected stream becomes null; Input received by the replicator is discarded until a new stream is selected or the replicator is put in broadcast mode (and there are any remaining streams connected).

Parameters:
streamId - Id of the stream to be disconnected.
close - Specifies whether the disconnected stream should also be closed.
Returns:
true if a stream associated with the given identifier was disconnected, false otherwise.

selectStream

public boolean selectStream(java.lang.Integer streamId)
Selects a stream to be the destination of received input.

Parameters:
streamId - Identifier of the stream to which to copy received input.
Returns:
true if the specified stream was selected, false if there is no stream associated with the replicator by the given identifer.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the replicator is no longer connected to the input source.

broadcast

public boolean broadcast()
Reports whether the replicator is in broadcast mode. In broadcast mode, the replicator copies the input to all connected streams.

Returns:
true if the replicator is in broadcast mode, false otherwise.

broadcast

public boolean broadcast(boolean state)
Specifies whether the replicator is in broadcast mode. In broadcast mode, the replicator copies the input to all connected streams.

Parameters:
state - true to put the replicator in broadcast mode, false to disable broadcast mode and return to using the last selected stream.
Returns:
Whether the replicator was already in broadcast mode.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the replicator is no longer connected to the input source.

streamCommandsEnabled

public boolean streamCommandsEnabled()
Reports whether the replicator is set to handle in-stream commands.

In-stream commands are primarily useful if the replicator is connected to multiple streams, and the input source is interactive (such as a console). The commands can be used to select the target stream to receive inputs, put the replicator in broadcast mode, and query for available streams. If the input source is not interactive, however, this may cause unexpected behavior or data mangling.

Returns:
true if the replicator is set to handle in-stream commands, false otherwise.

enableStreamCommands

public boolean enableStreamCommands(boolean state)
Specifies whether the replicator is set to handle in-stream commands.

In-stream commands are primarily useful if the replicator is connected to multiple streams, and the input source is interactive (such as a console). The commands can be used to select the target stream to receive inputs, put the replicator in broadcast mode, and query for available streams. If the input source is not interactive, however, this may cause unexpected behavior or data mangling.

Parameters:
state - true to activate handling of in-stream commands, false to transmit all input verbatim.
Returns:
Whether the replicator was already set to handle in-stream commands.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the replicator is no longer connected to the input source.

run

public void run()
Copies data from an input source to one or all connected streams in accordance with the replicator configuration.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
